title: Instant Message Problem
content:
Is there any way to apply a Hrant filter to the “Instant Messenger” feature of Typophile?

He keeps sending me nasty messages

 [‹ FF Meta vs Lexus Opti](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406143830/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15628 "Go to previous forum topic") [Fruitful Avoidance, Continued ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406143830/http:/www.typophile.com/node/16005 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Nick Shinn

comments.content:
Nick, me thinks no malice is intended — but what about setting up another (anonymous) account…? That way you are “not” logged in as Nick, but can participate anyway.

BTW I was reading the discussion re the new OTF version of ITC Avant Garde Gothic on this other site and I felt kind of \*small\* because the people involved were so knowledgable about the matter — even though I have been involved with type, typography and design for a quarter of a century. AND I have seen and read and appreciated all U&lc’s for ages.  
Maybe I should set up some special \*lurking\* accounts to get rid of that feeling… hah!

\>Nick, me thinks no malice is intended

You are mistaken, but he has since offered to stop these messages, so all is well.

Nick,

I have only know Hrant to be a fine gentleman. I am sure you have misunderstood his messages.

Gerald Giampa

I admit—your complaint seems founded.

Gerald Giampa
The instant message problem I have is messages will sometimes repeat and appear over and over again — sometimes seven or eight times. Then I delete them, and they are back the next time I log in.
